territory.notes: Colony of Portugal. Possibly known as “Sao Tome and Principe” between its discovery by Portugal (1470) and its establishment as a Portuguese colony, but record is not clear. The colony was established in 1493. Uninhabited prior to Portuguese discovery. In 1778 the islands of Fernando Pó (Bioko) and Annobón (Pagalu) were ceded from the Portuguese colony to Spain (the islands are now part of Equatorial Guinea.) Became independent on July 12, 1975.
